intro: Craspedia aurantia var. aurantia, commonly known as the golden craspedia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its stems are erect and branched. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal environments.
